intro: Bidens chiapensis var. feddemana, commonly known as the Fedden's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers with prominent white ray florets, typical of the genus Bidens. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and grasslands. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
